723342f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Rutgers Slip
723342f-a.text:
South Street, east from (No. 259) and including Rutgers Slip, showing work in progress on the Rutgers Street Subway Tunnel of the Independent System.
April 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, as seen from a point slightly southward. Also shown are
piers 34 and 35 East River.
April 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
723342f-a.folder: South Street & Rutgers Slip, Manhattan, NY

723341f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Rutgers Slip
723341f-a.text:
South Street, west from (No, 252) but not including Rutgers Slip, showing in the foreground a portion of the Manhattan Bridge. lIn the distance appears the Brooklyn Bridge. Silhouetted across the skyline, are;,the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co.; the 60 Wall Street Tower; the Bank of the Manhattan Co.; the Singer (with dome), and the Woolworth Buildings.
March 22, i937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly westward. The intersection shown in the foreground is Pike Slip. This Street parallels the East River of which,
several Piers are seen on the left.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
723341f-a.folder: South Street & Rutgers Slip, Manhattan, NY

723340f-b.title: Manhattan: South Street - Rutgers Slip
723340f-b.text:
South Street, at the N. W. corner of Rutgers Slip, showing several nondescript structures. 1he corner building is No. 259. To the left is s garage bearing No 255-58. The 7 story loft at the right is No. 84-6 Rutgers Slip, and is at the S. W. corner of
Water Street.
1: January 1924
2: April 16, 1928
P. L. Sperr
723340f-b.folder: South Street & Rutgers Slip, Manhattan, NY
